articles.title: Congratulations to PM of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim sent Congratulations to PM of Cote d'Ivoire
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on June 18 sent a congratulatory message to Guillaume Kigbafori Soro on his appointment as prime minister of Cote d'Ivoire.
					 The message wished him success in his work for national unity and social and economic development.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun also sent a similar message to Daniel Kablan Duncan on his appointment as foreign minister of Cote d'Ivoire on the same day.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on WPK's Line of Giving Priority to Ideological Work
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on WPK's Line of Giving Priority to Ideological Work
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- It is the consistent leadership principle of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) to give priority to ideology, says Rodong Sinmun on Sunday.
					 The daily dedicates a by-lined article to the anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential For Accomplishing Socialism."
					
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 84 (1995), elaborates on theoretical and practical issues arising in ideological work.
					
					 They include the importance of the ideological work in accomplishing the socialist cause, its essence and main task as well as contents, principles and methods.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il made sure that the ideology and fighting spirit of the People's Army prevail throughout the country. This is a result of the wise leadership he provided to advance the socialist cause by dint of ideology.
					
					 He also has constantly improved the styles and methods of the party ideological work in line with the demand of the stirring reality.
					
					 The Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il made the solider spirit become prevalent in the country and encouraged the army and people to stage a vigorous drive to effect a great surge.
					
					 The DPRK is now making leaps forward by the concerted efforts of the army and people. Armed with the revolutionary soldier spirit, they are performing great feats in the drive for a surge making advance at the Huichon speed, a new Chollima speed. This is the true picture of the DPRK today.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, brisk agitation activities of various styles and methods including agitation through visual aids and art performances have been positively conducted everywhere the drive for a great surge is staged.

articles.title: Dancing Parties Celebrate Start of Work at WPK
articles.content:
Dancing Parties Celebrate Start of Work at WPK
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Dancing parties of youth and students took place in different parts of the country on Sunday to celebrate the 47th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The dancing venues in Pyongyang included plazas of the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and the Arch of Triumph where young people started dancing to the tune of "Please Receive the Best Wishes of People".
					
					 The dancers extended the greatest glory to Kim Jong Il who performed immortal exploits before the era, the revolution, the country and the people.
					
					 They danced to the tune of songs "Glory to Our Great Party", "Youth, Forward Following the Party" and "Push back the Frontiers of Latest Science and Technology". Reflected in their dances were their resolution to grow up to be reliable successors of the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun youth vanguard.
					
					 Similar dancing parties were held in capitals of provinces on the same day.

articles.title: Art Squad of Youth League Gives Performance
articles.content:
Art Squad of Youth League Gives Performance 
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The Art Squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League performed at the plaza of the Party Founding Memorial Tower Sunday to celebrate the 47th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Colorful numbers included "Glory to the Great Our Party" and "I Sing of the Party".
					
					 The performers praised the immortal exploits by Kim Jong Il who ushered in a great heyday of rich and prosperous country by developing the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Such numbers as "Do Not Ask My Name", "Cuckoo" and "Young Man Whom I Found" well showed the great pride and optimism of young people leading a worthwhile life in the embrace of the mother party.
					
					 Officials of the youth league and youth and students in Pyongyang watched the performance.

articles.title: State Symphony Orchestra Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK
articles.content:
State Symphony Orchestra Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The State Symphony Orchestra gave a concert at the Moranbong Theatre Sunday to celebrate the 47th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Among the audience were senior party, state and army officials, officials of party and armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions.
					
					 Numbers included "Our General Is the Best", "We Will Be Loyal Down through Generations", "Song to the Party", "Chollima Runs" and "Oh, My Motherland of Songun".
					
					 The performers portrayed the boundless respect and thank for Kim Jong Il who has strengthened the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung and powerful guiding force of the Songun revolution and demonstrated the dignity and might of Juche Korea.
					
					 Orchestral music "Rich Harvest Comes to the Chongsan Plain" and "Swinging Girl" touched the heartstrings of the audience as they fully reflected the Juche character and national character.

articles.title: Pyongyang Seethed in Festive Mood
articles.content:
Pyongyang Seethed in Festive Mood
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea is celebrating the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					Pyongyang streets are decorated with flags of the WPK and the DPRK, red flags, posters, slogans, large electronic displays and lights.
					
					 A national meeting and public organizations' meetings were held to mark the anniversary. Speakers at the meetings lauded the great feats the leader has performed in developing the WPK and successfully guiding the Korean people's effort for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 Children gave an art performance at the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace and foreign students studying at Korean universities presented their compositions praising the DPRK leader.
					
					 Mass media have introduced feats of Kim Jong Il through a new documentary film and articles.

articles.title: DPRK Loses to Mexico at U-17 World Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Loses to Mexico at U-17 World Cup
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team lost to the Mexican team 3:1 on Saturday at its first league match of the Group A of the 2011 Under-17 World Cup held in Morelia, Mexico which hosts it.

articles.title: DPRK losed UAE -Olympic preliminaries
articles.content:
DPRK losed UAE -Olympic preliminaries
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK and the United Arab Emirates had the first soccer match in the second-stage Asian regional preliminaries for the 2012 Olympic Games at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Sunday.
					 The UAE won the first match 1:0.
					
					 The second match will be held in the UAE on June 23.

articles.title: One More Power Station Completed in DPRK
articles.content:
One More Power Station Completed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Suan Youth Power Station No. 2 went into operation with due ceremony in Suan County, North Hwanghae Province on Sunday.
					 The completion of one more minor hydroelectric power station in the county helped lay fresh material foundation for the development of local industry and improvement of people's living standards.

articles.title: Central Election Guidance Committee Formed
articles.content:
Central Election Guidance Committee Formed
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The central election guidance committee for election of deputies to provincial (municipality), city (district) and county people's assemblies was formed in the DPRK.
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly announced its decision on the formation of the committee on Saturday.
					
					 According to the decision, the central election guidance committee consists of Yang Hyong Sop as chairman, Choe Ryong Hae as vice-chairman, Pyon Yong Rip as secretary general and six persons as members.

articles.title: Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was brought out in booklet by Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of Russia on June 15. 
					 The work was published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997). It clarifies preserving the Juche character and national character in the revolution and construction is a fundamental principle for accomplishing the socialist cause. It also expounds tasks and ways for its materialization.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Celebrated Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration were celebrated in different countries from June 1 to 12. 
					 A meeting and lecture took place in Sweden, opening ceremonies of the DPRK's book, photo and handicraft exhibitions in Russia, Brazil and Peru and a ceremony for opening the week of photo exhibition in Nigeria. 
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, in his lecture said under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the WPK has displayed its might as a guiding force leading the Korean people in their efforts to realize their desire and demand.
					
					 The adoption of the historic inter-Korean declaration in Pyongyang on June 15, 2000 was an event of epochal significance in the movement for Korea's reunification and the declaration instilled the bright hope of reunification into the Koreans, he noted.
					
					 Eric Andersson, international secretary of the Communist Party of Sweden, praised Kim Jong Il's exploits in party building, saying the WPK is an invincible party transparent in its idea which has achieved single-minded unity with popular masses and deeply rooted among them. 
					
					 The director of the Bureau of Culture of the Ussuriysk City Administration, Maritime Territory of Russia, said the exhibition would help the people of the city more clearly understand about the DPRK under the leadership of the great leader.
					
					 The deputy director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory said Kim Jong Il has developed the WPK into a party absolutely supported by the people.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Sweden.

articles.title: Centenary of birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Centenary of birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The Bulgarian national preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung held a meeting at the building of the Bulgarian Anti-Fascist Union on June 13.
					 The meeting expressed full support for the decision of the consultative meeting of leading officials of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung and discussed the issues to implement it.
					
					 It is a great jubilee for world progressive mankind to commemorate together with the Korean people the birth anniversary of the President, a gifted thinker and theoretician, prominent elder statesman, outstanding strategist and master of leadership, said Chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association Simeon Ignatov who is vice-chairman of the national preparatory committee.
					
					 To mark the one hundred-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea, Bulgaria will hold in a planned way colorful political and cultural events praising the undying feats of the President who laid a cornerstone of friendship and solidarity between the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 The chairman of the Bulgarian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification referring to leader Kim Jong Il's recent successful visit to China said Kim Jong Il, dependable successor to the President's cause, is defending peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia with his original Songun politics.
					
					 We will further strengthen the movement for solidarity with the Korean people in their efforts to achieve the cause of independence and socialist construction against imperialism under the leadership of Kim Jong Il with 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, as a momentum, he added.
					
					 A decision was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: British Organizations Support Inter-Korean Declaration
articles.content:
British Organizations Support Inter-Korean Declaration 
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- British organizations supported the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration in statements on the 11th anniversary of the declaration.
					 The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a statement on June 11 said the joint declaration opened a new era of the movement for Korea's reunification. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The three principles for national reunification advanced by President Kim Il Sung has been applied to the joint declaration.
					
					 The declaration was provided thanks to the strong will, clairvoyant wisdom and energetic activities of general secretary Kim Jong Il who devotes his all to the reunification of Korea.
					
					 Events unimaginable in the past have taken place one after another between the north and the south of Korea since the adoption of the declaration.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak clique, however, has totally denied the declaration.
					
					 It is pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst phase while intensifying anti-DPRK moves.
					
					 The declaration clarifies the realistic way of realizing Korea's reunification, free from foreign forces' interference.
					
					 The U.S. is the very one which is blocking Korea's reunification after dividing the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We strongly demand the U.S. immediately withdraw its aggression forces from south Korea and refrain from obstructing Korea's reunification and the Lee clique discontinue the moves against the DPRK and reunification and sincerely implement the joint declaration.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a joint statement on June 13 referred to the significance of the adoption of the joint declaration and reaffirmed full support for it.

articles.title: Iran Launches Satellite
articles.content:
Iran Launches Satellite
 Tehran, June 18 (KCNA) -- Iran made a successful satellite launch on June 15.
					 The satellite weighs 15.3 kg and goes round the earth 15 times in 24 hours. All the processes from designing and manufacture to testing and preparations have been done by Iranian experts, a report said.

articles.title: Sudan Calls on U.S. to Stop "Carrot, Stick Policy"
articles.content:
Sudan Calls on U.S. to Stop "Carrot, Stick Policy"
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs accused the U.S. of its wrong policy toward Sudan in a statement on June 15.
					 The U.S. chief executive said "I want to speak directly to Sudanese leaders: you must know that if you fulfill your obligations and choose peace, the United States will take the steps we have pledged toward normal relations. However, those who flout their international obligations will face more pressure and isolation".
					
					 Flatly rejecting this, the statement said:
					
					 "The Sudanese government does not perform its responsibilities in desire for normalization or in fear of sanctions, and the U.S. administration should cease its carrot and stick policy which it has kept practicing."

articles.title: S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Policy Rejected
articles.content:
S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Confrontation Policy Rejected
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean opposition Democratic Party strongly accused the present authorities of their anti-DPRK confrontation policy. It held a meeting of its executive chairmen at Rimjin Pavilion in Phaju, Kyonggi Province on June 1, south Korean CBS reported.
					 Speakers said June 15, 2000 was a historic day when the top leaders of the south and the north met and declared to put an end to the era of division.
					
					 But the north-south relations have now reached the worst phase in history, they deplored.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime's "policy toward the north" went up in smoke, they said, demanding the authorities totally withdraw the confrontation policy and respect the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Czech Republic Rejects U.S. Military Facility-Defense Minister
articles.content:
Czech Republic Rejects U.S. Military Facility-Defense Minister
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The government of the Czech Republic stands against the building of the U.S. military facility in the country. The Czech defense minister clarified this at a press conference on June 15. 
					 The U.S. plans to set up an early warning centre in the Czech Republic as part of the missile defense system in Europe, he said, reiterating his government's decision not to accept it.
					
					 The Czech Republic does not need the U.S. early warning centre, he emphasized.

articles.title: Actions against Lee Myung Bak's Moves for Confrontation with North Staged
articles.content:
Actions against Lee Myung Bak's Moves for Confrontation with North Staged
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- At least 10 civic and public organizations of south Korea held the 141st action for independence, reunification and peace before the U.S. embassy in Seoul on June 14. They condemned the Lee Myung Bak group for its moves for confrontation with the DPRK. They included the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Confederation of Trade Unions.
					 A resolution said the disclosure of the authorities' base act behind the secret north-south contact has been recently disclosed, increasing public voices critical of them.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime pushed the inter-Korean relations to a standstill by blaming the "Cheonan" warship case on the "north's deed". It was astonishing that he asked for the "summit" while making some compromising proposal, the resolution said.
					
					 It is difficult to improve the inter-Korean relations as long as the present regime continues pursuing the confrontation policy against fellow countrymen, it added.
					
					 If the Lee regime has a true willingness for the "summit", it should abandon the confrontation policy, first of all, and come up for dialogue with the north, it stressed.

articles.title: Puerto Rico, Ukraine Call for Release Cuban Patriots
articles.content:
Puerto Rico, Ukraine Call for Release Cuban Patriots
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The Puerto Rico Committee for Solidarity with Cuba recently sent a protest letter to the U.S. president demanding the release of five Cuban patriots detained in the U.S. prison.
					 Terming the U.S. judgment against the Cuban patriots unreasonable, the letter urged the U.S. to set them free at an early date.
					
					 Meanwhile, a signature campaign calling for the release of the Cuban patriots was conducted in Ukraine. It was attended by 40,000 personages of different social standings, a report said.

articles.title: U.S. Hit for Trying to Avoid Blame for Environment Pollution
articles.content:
U.S. Hit for Trying to Avoid Blame for Environment Pollution
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea staged a demonstration before the U.S. military base in Ryongsan, Seoul on June 14 in protest against the U.S. base moves to avoid the blame for the environment pollution.
					 The demonstrators were enraged at the fact that the U.S. is not properly probing the truth but trying to conceal its crimes though it is blustering that it is making an investigation into the burial of defoliant.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. government make an official apology for the organized and systematic environment pollution and opt for total revision of the south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement".
					
					 They expressed their will to wage a more dynamic struggle against the U.S., chanting slogans "U.S. forces, get home as it sees our land as a dumping ground!"

articles.title: Iran Condemns U.S. for Its Hegemonic Foreign Policy
articles.content:
Iran Condemns U.S. for Its Hegemonic Foreign Policy
 Tehran, June 18 (KCNA) -- The deputy secretary of the Supreme National Security Council of Iran in a speech at a recent event critically condemned the U.S. for its hegemonic foreign policy.
					 He said that the nuclear terrorism and nuclear hypocrisy are tools in the hands of the United States to push ahead with its international policies.
					
					 While threatening other countries with nuclear weapons, the U.S. portrays itself as the "upholder" of the nuclear disarmament and tries to destroy the nations' efforts to gain access to scientific achievements, he stated, branding it as a dictatorial politics of modern version.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Papua New Guinea
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Papua New Guinea
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- A 6.6-magnitude earthquake jolted an area of Papua New Guinea on June 16.
					 The epicenter was 47.4 km deep in the area.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Shifting Blame for "Cheonan" Warship Case onto DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Shifting Blame for "Cheonan" Warship Case onto DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Jong Tong Yong, executive chairman of the opposition Democratic Party of south Korea, in an interview with KBS on June 15 said that the story about north's involvement in the "Cheonan" warship case is a far-fetched assertion, the south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					 The stand that there was no other than the north which was involved in the case is not objective and scientific, he noted.
					
					 It is quite natural that the people threw doubt on the results of investigation announced by the "government", he said.
					
					 It is wrong that the authorities are taking an unreasonable and biased attitude, seeing those who are suspicious of the investigation results as "pro-north leftist ones", he stressed.

articles.title: U.S. Preparations for Korean War Disclosed
articles.content:
U.S. Preparations for Korean War Disclosed
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- One more fact was recently disclosed that the U.S. has been making preparations for an invasion of the DPRK with Japan as a base.
					 The Japanese Asahi Shimbun dated June 15 quoted a U.S. diplomatic document as saying that the U.S. busied itself collecting detailed information for the use of Japan's airports and seaports for military operations in the "contingency of the Korean Peninsula" in 2008.
					
					 At that time the U.S. repeatedly asked the Japanese government to haste the field survey of civilian airports and seaports in Japan, the paper added.

articles.title: U.S. Projected Deployment of New Military Equipment Protested in Japan
articles.content:
U.S. Projected Deployment of New Military Equipment Protested in Japan
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- A sit-in strike was staged in Kinowan City, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan on June 13 in protest against the projected provision of the U.S. forces in Japan with new military equipment.
					 The strike was held outside the city office in protest against the U.S. forces' scheme to deploy MV-22 Osprey, new VTOL, at the Futenma base in Okinawa. Attending it were many citizens of various strata.
					
					 They pressed for a cancellation of the plan, saying that the deployment of the VTOL should never be allowed for the safety of children.

articles.title: Housing Problem Gets More Serious in U.S.
articles.content:
Housing Problem Gets More Serious in U.S.
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Many U.S. poor people are leading an outdoors life without their houses as the house prices are very high. 
					 More than 51 000 people were registered as homeless in Los Angeles City in 2010, the city authorities said on June 14.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Keep Cluster Bombs Exposed
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Keep Cluster Bombs Exposed
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Japan's base moves to keep internationally banned cluster bombs was disclosed, stirring up a furor, the Japanese Mainichi Shimbun said on June 16.
					 Quoting WikiLeaks, the newspaper said the Japanese government conferred with the U.S. government on the issue of keeping cluster bombs of the U.S. forces in Japan after the international treaty banning the use of cluster bombs was signed.
					
					 This has brought to light the Japanese government's double-faced attitude to rely on the cluster bombs of the U.S. forces despite its outward opposition, the paper added.

articles.title: DPRK Papers Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
articles.content:
DPRK Papers Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Papers Sunday devote editorials to the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Rodong Sinmun praises undying feats by Kim Jong Il in his nearly five-decade long party building and leadership.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 He built the WPK into the revolutionary party shining with the august name of President Kim Il Sung, a genuine guide and protector with responsibility for the destiny of the country and the people and an ever-victorious party bringing shining reality once it is determined.
					
					 The WPK considers the President's revolutionary idea and behests as unique guiding idea and immutable programme. Its political mode is the revolutionary leadership mode created and applied by the President. Its admirable organizing and mobilizing ability by which it directs the mental power of the army and people into building a thriving nation is exactly the same as the one practiced by the President.
					
					 The party and the state invariably put into force the popular policies despite the worst situation and the gigantic march for building a thriving nation is making dynamic progress and the June 15 era of reunification was ushered in this land. This is an admirable picture that can be presented by the WPK which is applying Kim Jong Il's policy of loving the country and the people.
					
					 The people are praising the WPK as the mother party to which they should entrust their destiny and future. All the Koreans are looking up to him as the lodestar of national reunification.
					
					 Under his leadership the WPK is displaying its militant might in the grand offensive for effecting a great surge. Kim Jong Il's outstanding wisdom is associated with the WPK's scientific line and policies and the general political and ideological offensive of great vitality.
					
					 Minju Joson says that Kim Jong Il has firmly consolidated the foundation for the eternal prosperity of Kim Il Sung's Korea by strengthening the party and raising its leading role in every way. This shines brightly as the greatest historical merit by Kim Jong Il before the era, the revolution, the country and people.

articles.title: Senior Chinese Official Urges Promotion of Tour of Revolutionary Sites
articles.content:
Senior Chinese Official Urges Promotion of Tour of Revolutionary Sites
 Beijing, June 18 (KCNA) -- China has taken measures to promote tour of revolutionary sites as part of its efforts to intensify the education in the revolutionary traditions.
					 At a national meeting in Beijing Liu Yunshan, head of Publicity Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC), said promoting the tour of revolutionary sites is an important and strategic decision the CPC has made to inherit the excellent revolutionary traditions and consolidate its ruling foundation.
					
					 He underscored the need to make the party members and other officials to learn about the party history and nurture the party spirit through the tour of the revolutionary sites associated with the hard-fought struggle and scenic spots. It is also necessary to help broad masses nourish patriotism and school youth and children learn the revolutionary traditions through the tour, the official added.

articles.title: Chinese Youth Tour Old Revolutionary Bases to Study CPC History
articles.content:
Chinese Youth Tour Old Revolutionary Bases to Study CPC History
 Beijing, June 18 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Communist Youth League of China recently organized study and consolation activities in Mt. Jinggang in Jiangxi Province and Yan' an in Shaanxi Province.
					 The aim was to let the youth and students study the history of the Communist Party of China (CPC), know its actual condition and follow it.

articles.title: Bolivia Marks Birth Anniversary of Che Guevara
articles.content:
Bolivia Marks Birth Anniversary of Che Guevara 
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The 83rd birth anniversary of internationalist soldier Che Guevara was commemorated in Valle Grande, Bolivia on June 13.
					 A national event and other various events took place to cherish the memory of Che Guevara and his guerillas.

articles.title: Iran to Build Cyber Command
articles.content:
Iran to Build Cyber Command
 Tehran, June 18 (KCNA) -- Iran plans to set up a cyber command, said a senior Iranian army official on Tuesday.
					 The command is to counter the enemies' cyber warfare against Iran, he added.

articles.title: Venezuelan Lawyer Proposes Disclosing U.S. Intervention
articles.content:
Venezuelan Lawyer Proposes Disclosing U.S. Intervention
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Eva Golinger, a lawyer and writer of Venezuela, at a recent press conference proposed to organize a center meant to disclose the U.S. intervention in internal affairs of his country.
					 He has thousands of documents showing the U.S. acts against Venezuela, he said, adding it is critical to establish a research center.
					
					 The U.S. increased its intervention in Venezuela, he noted, accusing the U.S. administration of giving a financial backstop to resistance forces in his country.

articles.title: Earthquake Occurs 16 Km SW of Paekryong Island
articles.content:
Earthquake Occurs 16 Km SW of Paekryong Island
 Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- A 4.1-magnitude earthquake occurred 16 km southwest of Paekryong Island in the West Sea of Korea on Friday, according to south Korean CBS.
					 The shock was felt on the island and some areas of Inchon.
